data.title: Stronger by August Strindberg, First Edition
data.meta_description: MISS JULIA, THE STRONGER by August Strindberg and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. First UK Edition. Translated from the Swedish, with an introduction by Edwin Bjorkman. Authorized edition and first British edition. With an introduction and a 17 page author's preface to the play. ***Very good in the publisher's original olive green cloth with gilt titles to the spine - gilt is unfaded which is unusual. Corners and edges slightly worn and bumped. No inscriptions. ***30mm x 196mm ~ 90 pages plus 18 page publisher's catalogue at the rear. ***'Miss Julia remains Strindberg's most famous work. In the history of drama, it is primarily canonized for its stylistic innovations. Its preface serves as a classic manifesto of late-nineteenth century naturalism. Strindberg is also venerated as a progenitor of the expressionist theater. Expressionist devices are present throughout Miss Julia and Strindberg's other works. Key examples include continual allusions to mystical forces, the use of symbology and ritualized dance, the backdrop of the pagan festival, and the construction of an absent, shadowy, and yet precipitating center of authority in the figure of the Count. Censored for its shocking content, Miss Julia revolves around a familiar Strindbergian encounter: a quasi-Darwinian struggle across sex and class lines.' [Quote taken from "Strindberg: Plays One" - published by Methuen in 1988] ***The first British edition of this famous play. ***For all our books, postage is charged at cost, allowing for packaging: any shipping rates indicated on ABE are an average only: we will reduce the P & P charge where appropriate - please contact us for postal rates for heavier books and sets etc.***.

Hardcover. First edition. Very Good. Rare First Edition. Miss Julia remains Strindberg's most famous work. In the history of drama, it is primarily canonized for its stylistic innovations. Its preface serves as a classic manifesto of late-nineteenth century naturalism. Strindberg is also venerated as a progenitor of the expressionist theater. Expressionist devices are present throughout Miss Julia and Strindberg's other works. Key examples include continual allusions to mystical forces, the use of symbology and ritualized dance, the backdrop of the pagan festival, and the construction of an absent, shadowy, and yet precipitating center of authority in the figure of the Count. Censored for its shocking content, Miss Julia revolves around a familiar Strindbergian encounter: a quasi-Darwinian struggle across sex and class lines. Top edge gilt. Brown cloth with gilt titling on front and spine. Corners bumped, with wear/rubbing at corners and top & tail of spine. Mild toning at ends; notations in pencil on rear free endpaper; otherwise interior is clean, crisp, tight & bright, unmarked. 90 pp. Approx. 5.5" x 8". A very nice copy and an excellent addition to your library. Carefully shipped in secure parcel. Ask all questions; glad to respond.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Very Good or better copy of this first hardcover edition. Two Strindberg plays translated into English by Edwin Bjorkman, the "Authorized Edition." Copyright page states "Published August, 1912" and has the Scribner's seal at the bottom. A touch of wear to top and bottom of spine. Hinges tight. Gilt top edge and titles on front board bright, titles on spine a bit less so. Touch of foxing to untrimmed fore-edge. Small bookseller's stamp on rear board. Very nice copy.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. This copy is from the personal library of the late Madeleine L'Engle, 1963 Newbery Award winner for her now classic young adult fantasy novel A WRINKLE IN TIME, and bears her handwritten name and New York City address on the front paste-down. Translated from the Swedish by Edith and Warner Oland. First edition thus. Bumped and worn at the spine ends and corners, else very good in dark blue cloth with gilt lettering and design. No dust jacket.
